data.title: 1975 Pontiac Lil Wide Track Astre HB
data.meta_description: Seller is Probably Correct that his is the only 1 left. The H-body community had been wondering if any still existed for along time when this one...
data.text:
Seller is Probably Correct that his is the only 1 left. The H-body community had been wondering if any still existed for along time when this one appeared last year.

Bought from the original owner by a Chevy guy that was going to make a drag car out of it until he found out what he had. Sold for about 1/2 the current asking price last year. Neat car but it is only a Spoiler and stipe package done by a outside vender and sold thru Pontiac Dealers. The only thing it is missing is the odd rear 1/4 glass louvers. Nice looking car. But I would not dream of paying any more than $5000.00 for it.

I spoke to Jim Wangers about these cars years ago, he claims they built 3000 I don't think they actually Built 300 of them myself.

I was disappointed to learn that every car they actually built was Silver, non of the optional colors of the last flyer I posted made it into production. Also every car was equipped with the base 1bbl Engine, and every car had an automatic trans. I have found that the 2bbl equipped cars with a 4 or 5 speed trans can be fun to drive. But I test drove a single 1bbl automatic car and it was so sloooow I never looked at another one.

So these cars were the best example of the 70's Stripe and Spoiler performance cars I can think of. Jim Wangers is still an ad man so I should consider the source of the car.

http://seattle.craigslist.org/see/cto/4692224710.html

Here's the Sales Brochure

And some shots from Jim Wangers of the original Prototype

And of the Artist conception of a Possible Wagon Version that was never Built.
